title: Melatonin
shortDescription: In one study in the Journal of Clinical Gastroenterology half a group of 60 acid reflux patients took 5 mg of melatonin every evening and the other half took a placebo. After 12 weeks, researchers found that more than half of the patients taking melatonin reported some relief from their symptoms, while less than ten percent of the patients taking the placebo saw any change in their acid reflux symptoms.
description: In one study in the Journal of Clinical Gastroenterology half a group of 60 acid reflux patients took 5 mg of melatonin every evening and the other half took a placebo. After 12 weeks, researchers found that more than half of the patients taking melatonin reported some relief from their symptoms, while less than ten percent of the patients taking the placebo saw any change in their acid reflux symptoms.
warnings:
Melatonin is an anticoagulant and may increase the risk of bleeding from anticoagulant medications such as warfarin or other supplements that like Omega-3 Fish Oils that are strong anticoagulants.

Melatonin may reduce the effectiveness of blood pressure medications like methoxamine and clonidine. 

Interleukin-2 -- In one study of 80 cancer patients, use of melatonin in conjunction with interleukin-2 led to more tumor regression and better survival rates than treatment with interleukin-2 alone. 

NSAIDs such as ibuprofen may reduce the levels of melatonin in the blood. 

Steroids and immunosuppressant medications -- People should not take melatonin with corticosteroids or other medications used to suppress the immune system because the supplement may cause them to be ineffective. 

Tamoxifen -- Preliminary research suggests that the combination of tamoxifen (a chemotherapy drug) and melatonin may benefit certain patients with breast and other cancers. More research is needed to confirm these results.

title: Soft Mint Candy
shortDescription: Soft Mint Candy produces copious amounts of mucus when you suck on them and people claim that Soft Mint Candy are more effective than any cough drops.
description: Soft Mint Candy produces copious amounts of mucus when you suck on them and people claim that Soft Mint Candy are more effective than any cough drops.
warnings: Soft Mint Candy  are usually large round balls and can easily block your bbreathing if you are not carefukl when sucking them.

title: Sleep on Left Side
shortDescription: Researchers have found that sleeping on your left side can help reduce acid reflux during the night.
description: Researchers have found that sleeping on your left side can help reduce acid reflux during the night.
warnings: If you sleep on the left side of your body then you should also sleep on the left side of the bed to avoid reducing blood flow to your left arm.

title: Deglycyrrhizinated Licorice
shortDescription: Deglycyrrhizinated licorice, or DGL, is an herbal supplement typically used in the treatment of gastric and duodenal ulcers. It is made from licorice from which the glycyrrhizin has been removed. Glycyrrhizin is known to cause very dangerous side effects, such as hypertension and edema; removing the glycyrrhizin is meant to avoid these symptoms.
description:
Deglycyrrhizinated licorice, or DGL, is an herbal supplement typically used in the treatment of gastric and duodenal ulcers. It is made from licorice from which the glycyrrhizin has been removed. Glycyrrhizin is known to cause very dangerous side effects, such as hypertension and edema; removing the glycyrrhizin is meant to avoid these symptoms. 

Deglycyrrhizinated liquorice plus antacid is marketed in Europe, South Africa, and Canada, as the medicinal preparation Caved-S. In the United States, DGL is marketed as an herbal supplement. An un-blinded study of 82 patients from the early 1980s, published in the British Medical Journal, reported that Caved-S had a therapeutic effect similar to that of cimetidine in the treatment of gastric ulcers.

shortDescription:

description:

Remedies for Acid Reflux
Good for for Acid Reflux..
Oatmeal

Fish&Seafood
Parsley
Fennel - Fennel has been used throughout the world for soothing of gastroesophageal acid and reflux symptoms. In ancient
traditional Greek remedies, fennel seeds were boiled and used as a heartburn, indigestion and acid relief. Fennel contains
a compound called "Anethole", which suppresses spasms of the stomach.
Greens-Roots - Green beans, asparagus, broccoli, leafy greens and root vegetables are among the top vegetables which can
prevent acid reflux. Rich in healthy nutrients, fibres and active enzymes, they help create an internal environment
that prohibits acids from building up. Greens are easy to digest, therefore your stomach won't need to work nearly as
hard or produce nearly as much acid as it would with other foods.

title: Baking Soda
shortDescription: Baking soda is also helpful in treating acid reflux. Baking soda, or sodium bicarbonate, helps neutralize acid in the body as well as maintain a balanced pH level in the bloodstream. This restoration of balance in the body reduces the acidity of acids in the stomach, which prevents the harmful effects of acid reflux.
description: Baking soda is also helpful in treating acid reflux. Baking soda, or sodium bicarbonate, helps neutralize acid in the body as well as maintain a balanced pH level in the bloodstream. This restoration of balance in the body reduces the acidity of acids in the stomach, which prevents the harmful effects of acid reflux.
warnings:
